system.description: The true healers of the world, they are committed to sustaining all life. The truly altruistic characters, Life Mages are known to enter battles on neither side, healing anyone and everyone who they can. Obsessed with keeping people alive and conquering death, Life Mages are not as righteous as the Paladin but much more humble and kind. Shying away from combat, they prefer to stand behind the troops, healing when needed. If you are playing a Life Mage be helpful, kind and loving, protective but committed to saving lives and fighting death.

overview.base: Having mastered the basic techniques in this field of magic, you are able to cast more advanced @L[Category:Spells]{spells}. If you create any @L[Core:Elder Sorcery]{Elder Sorcery} @L[Category:Spells]{spells} of your own, they get added to this list. However, just because you "know" how to cast these spells, doesn't mean you are always prepared to. Although all @L[Category:Mage classes]{mage classes} grant their own elder sorcery and rotator spells, you may only have a maximum of 2 × (@L[Category:Mage classes]{MR} - 1) of these spells rotated into your spell list at any given time across all classes. @L[Category:Mage classes]{MR} refers to the number of @L[Core:Leveling Up]{ranks} you have in @L[Category:Mage classes]{mage classes}. During a @L[Core:Long Rest]{long rest}, you can "rotate" which spells you have prepared. The @L[Category:Rotator spells]{rotator spells} automatically available to you are @L[Ability:Blessing]{Blessing}, @L[Ability:Crown of Light]{Crown of Light}, @L[Ability:Glow of Healing]{Glow of Healing}, @L[Ability:Rebirth]{Rebirth}, and @L[Ability:Ward]{Ward}.
overview.proficient: You may instead prepare @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{P} of these @L[Category:Spells]{spells}.
overview.fluent: You may instead prepare @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{F} of these @L[Category:Spells]{spells}.

overview.base: You gain @L[Ability:Elder Sorcery Creation]{Elder Sorcery Creation}, @L[Ability:Celestial Elder Sorcery Words]{Celestial Elder Sorcery Words}, and @L[Ability:Life Elder Sorcery Words]{Life Elder Sorcery Words}.
Choose 1 ability from your deity's domains chart. You may bless 1 target with this ability.
overview.proficient: You may choose 2 × @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{P} abilities from your deity's domains chart and bless 2 × @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{P} targets with 1 of them.
overview.fluent: You may choose 2 × @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{F} abilities from your deity's domains chart and bless 2 × @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{F} targets with 2 of them.

system.heightened: For each additional @L[Core:MP]{MP} spent, you may target 1 additional creature.

overview.base: You may create 1 custom "rotator" @L[Category:Spells]{spells} using @L[Core:Elder Sorcery]{Elder Sorcery} words that you know using whatever @L[Core:Elder Sorcery]{Elder Sorcery} creation rules are dictated to you by your @L[Core:GM]{GM}. As with other rotators, this spell is not always available to you. You have to "rotate" into having it prepared. This spell may have a maximum number of words equal to your @L[Core:Leveling Up]{level}. Your @L[Core:GM]{GM} may allow you to "improvise" @L[Category:Spells]{spells} as well, using whatever rules they wish.
overview.proficient: You may now create 2 × (@L[Category:Mage classes]{MR} - 1) custom "rotator" @L[Category:Spells]{spells} where @L[Category:Mage classes]{MR} is the number of @L[Core:Leveling Up]{ranks} you have in @L[Category:Mage classes]{mage classes}.
overview.fluent: In addition to the spells that you crate, you can learn @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{P} additional spells from other @L[Core:Elder Sorcery]{Elder Sorcery} users. See @L[Core:Elder Sorcery]{Elder Sorcery} for more information.

value.variable: Creation cost is at least 1 @L[Core:MP]{MP} per @L[Core:Elder Sorcery]{OP} of each word in the spell plus 3 × @L[Core:MP]{MP} of the spell itself.
Creation cost is at least 3 × @L[Core:HP]{HP} of the spell itself.

costs.materialCost: Creation cost is at least 3 × the material components of the spell itself.

overview.base: A small circle of golden light circles above your head. You gain @L[Ability:Light Touch]{Light Touch} and @L[Ability:Light Aura]{Light Aura}.

You know @L[Core:Elder Sorcery]{OP} 1 @L[Core:Celestial Elder Sorcery Words]{Celestial Elder Sorcery words}.
OP 1 Celestial @L[Core:Elder Sorcery Words]{Elder Sorcery Words}
OP Celestial Adjectives Celestial Adverbs Celestial Articles Celestial Conjunctions Celestial Nouns Celestial Prepositions Celestial Pronouns Celestial Verbs
1 bad as an as color by me are
big carefully one but cup for my be
bright here the or dagger in that begin
clean pretty so foot of this did
little then hand off you may
long there hat on your might
short today skin to stand
small torch tend
this wand use
overview.proficient: The @L[Core:Elder Sorcery]{OP} of words you know is 1 + (3 × @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{P}).
overview.fluent: The @L[Core:Elder Sorcery]{OP} of words you know is 1 + (3 × @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{F}).

results.hit: Target is @L[Condition:Lighted]{lighted}.
results.critHit: The target automatically fails the first [[/roll 2d4]] roll.

system.heightened: For each additional @L[Core:MP]{MP} spent, deal an additional [[/damage 1d4[magic holy]]] @L[Core:Damage]{damage} as well.
system.endCondition: At the end of each of the target's @L[Core:Turn]{turns}, they roll [[/roll 2d4]]. If either of these dice roll a 4, this effect ends.

overview.base:
You know @L[Core:Elder Sorcery]{OP} 1 @L[Core:Life Elder Sorcery Words]{Life Elder Sorcery words}.
OP 1 Life @L[Core:Elder Sorcery Words]{Elder Sorcery Words}
OP @L[Class:Life Mage]{Life Nouns} @L[Class:Life Mage]{Life Verbs}
1 amulet calm
burn defend
health detect
hurt mend
illness prevent
symbol repel
talisman restrain
valor shelter
wounds soothe
overview.proficient: The @L[Core:Elder Sorcery]{OP} of words you know is 1 + (3 × @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{P}).
overview.fluent: The @L[Core:Elder Sorcery]{OP} of words you know is 1 + (3 × @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{F}).

results.fail: Target is @L[Condition:Lighted]{lighted}.

system.heightened: For each additional @L[Core:MP]{MP} spent, You automatically fail the first [[/roll 2d4]] roll.
system.endCondition: At the end of each of the target's @L[Core:Turn]{turns}, they roll [[/roll 2d4]]. If either of these dice roll a 4, this effect ends.

overview.base: You gain @L[Ability:Healing Touch]{Healing Touch} and @L[Ability:Cure Illness]{Cure Illness}.

results.hit: Target is no longer @L[Condition:Poisoned]{poisoned} and is @L[Core:Healing]{healed} at the start of your next @L[Core:Turns]{turn}.

system.heightened: For each additional @L[Core:MP]{MP} spent, target is @L[Core:Healing]{healed} again at the start of your next @L[Core:Turns]{turn}.

overview.base: Make an @L[Tradecraft:Herbalist]{herbalist} check. The @L[Core:GM]{GM} determines the difficulty based on the severity of the illness. The @L[Core:GM]{GM} may also require you to have access to specific ingredients or tools or put other conditions in place. If the illness is mental in nature, then Cure Illness acts as a @L[Category:Mental effects]{mental effect}.
overview.proficient: You are @L[Keyword:Adept]{adept} at Cure Illness. Before you make the check, you may spend 1 additional @L[Core:MP]{MP} to know the DC if it is less than your total level. You may also add your @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{proficiency bonus} to the @L[Tradecraft:Herbalist]{herbalist} check regardless of whether or not you are proficient in @L[Tradecraft:Herbalist]{herbalist}.

results.save: The target is cured of the illness.
results.fail: The target is not cured, but the illness does not worsen for the duration of Healing Touch. You may cast Cure Illness again to keep the disease from progressing, but you may not attempt the check again.

system.heightened: For each additional @L[Core:MP]{MP} spent, The DC of the check is reduced by 1.

overview.proficient: If target is undead, they are @L[Core:Healing]{healed} for Damage @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{P} times.
overview.fluent: If target is undead, they are @L[Core:Healing]{healed} for Damage @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{F} times.

results.hit: If target is @L[Condition:Dead]{dead}, they are brought back to life. If they had less than 1 @L[Core:HP]{HP}, they have 1 @L[Core:HP]{HP}. If they had less than 1 @L[Core:MP]{MP}, they have 1 @L[Core:MP]{MP}. Otherwise, their @L[Core:HP]{HP} and @L[Core:MP]{MP} do not change. If target is undead, you can choose to have them be @L[Core:Healing]{healed} for Damage.

system.heightened: For each additional @L[Core:MP]{MP} spent, target can have been @L[Condition:Dead]{dead} for an additional 10 minutes. If target is undead, they are @L[Core:Healing]{healed} an additional time.
system.requirements: Target is undead or has @L[Condition:Dead]{died} within the last 10 minutes.

results.hit: Target item's next @L[Category:Attack abilities]{attack} is @L[Keyword:Warded]{warded}. You may also target a creature's hand. If you do, the creature's next @L[Category:Hand delivery spells]{hand} or @L[Category:Missile delivery spells]{missile spell} is @L[Keyword:Warded]{warded}.
